clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Amlodipine Besylate at Delivery and During Lactation
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Amlodipine Besylate at Delivery and During Lactation

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

collaborator.agency: National Center for Advancing Translational Science (NCATS)

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase IV prospective trial to collect and analyze information about the maternal pharmacokinetics of amlodipine besylate at the time of delivery and during postpartum lactation. The study will also evaluate amlodipine concentrations in the infants of breastfeeding mothers who are taking amlodipine besylate for treatment chronic hypertension.

detailed_description.textblock:
We plan to evaluate the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine besylate at the time of delivery, to determine if transplacental passage of the drug occurs. We will also examine the drug kinetics in postpartum lactation to establish whether amlodipine is excreted into breast milk. The outcomes of interest are plasma concentration of amlodipine at delivery and the drug concentrations in blood and breast milk over a twenty-hour steady-state period following milk-supply establishment. Fifteen patients already taking 5 mg of amlodipine during pregnancy for the treatment of chronic hypertension will be recruited from the antepartum Obstetric Complications Clinic at Parkland Hospital. Only women who are breastfeeding will be eligible for the study. Patients who elect to participate in the study will continue their amlodipine 5 mg dosing through delivery and into the postpartum period. Maternal blood will be drawn within one hour of delivery and fetal cord blood collected at the time of delivery. Patients will then have blood drawn over a 24 hour period beginning on postpartum day 2 after delivery following administration of their once-daily amlodipine dose. At each blood draw, the patient will also use a breast pump to express breast milk for paired analysis. Both blood and breast milk amlodipine levels will be calculated for all samples. The levels will be used to determine the pharmacokinetics of amlodipine in the peri- and postpartum patient, including concentrations in plasma and breast milk.
In addition to collecting maternal data, a range of clinical information will be collected on each study patient's infant including weight, Apgar scores, hemodynamic parameters, physical examination and hospital course. This information will be used to screen for any potential complications associated with infant exposure to amlodipine. An infant blood sample will also be obtained in conjunction with the routine neonatal blood collection that occurs at 1-2 days of postnatal life and this will be analyzed to determine serum amlodipine concentration in breastfeeding infants.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve for Amlodipine in the Maternal Serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: Maternal blood samples will be obtained at 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 24 hours after amlodipine dosing
primary_outcome.description: The time to peak amlodipine concentration in the maternal serum in the peripartum period was be measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximal Concentration in the Maternal Serum.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Maternal blood samples were obtained at 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 24 hours after amlodipine dosing
primary_outcome.description: The time to reach maximal amlodipine concentration in the maternal serum in the peripartum period was measured.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Maternal blood samples were obtained at 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 24 hours after amlodipine dosing
primary_outcome.description: The maximum concentration of amlodipine detected in the maternal serum in the peripartum period was measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Half-life of Amlodipine in Maternal Plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: Maternal blood samples were obtained at 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 24 hours after amlodipine dosing
primary_outcome.description: The half-life of amlodipine in the maternal plasma in the peripartum period was measured.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Maternal blood samples were obtained at 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 24 hours after amlodipine dosing
primary_outcome.description: The clearance rate of amlodipine from the maternal plasma was measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Drug Levels/Concentration in Cord Blood (Amlodipine Levels/Concentrations)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pair maternal blood sample and cord blood sample will draw within 1 hour of delivery
primary_outcome.description: Maternal and cord blood amlodipine levels/concentrations will be determined.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Breast milk samples were obtained at 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 24 hours after amlodipine dosing
primary_outcome.description: The concentration of amlodipine besylate was measured in breastmilk samples.

primary_outcome.measure: Drug Level/Concentration in Infant Blood (Amlodipine Level/Concentration)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Infant blood sample drawn at approximately 36 hours of life
primary_outcome.description: Infant amlodipine level/concentration will be determined.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Neonatal weight at the time of birth.
secondary_outcome.description: The neonatal weight at birth was collected.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Gestational age at the time of birth
secondary_outcome.description: The mean gestational age of infants born to mothers taking Amlodipine besylate 5 mg daily was collected.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from birth to hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The length of stay of infants born to women taking amlodipine besylate will be collected.

Any major complications experienced by infants born to women taking amlodipine besylate including NICU admission, intraventricular hemorrhage, neonatal seizures, need for respiratory support and apnea were collected.

arm_group.description: Women already taking amlodipine besylate 5 mg for treatment of chronic hypertension in pregnancy who plan to breastfeed postpartum will be assigned to the single experimental arm.

intervention.description: Pregnant and postpartum women will continue taking amlodipine besylate 5 mg for treatment of chronic hypertension as prescribed by their clinician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older;
- Pregnant female
- Already taking amlodipine 5 mg for treatment of chronic hypertension in pregnancy;
- Hospitalized following routine term vaginal delivery or uncomplicated cesarean delivery
- Breastfeeding or breast and bottle-feeding their infant
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known kidney disease
- Delivery complicated by chorioamnionitis, endometritis or postpartum hemorrhage
- Administration of greater than 5 mg of amlodipine in 24 hour period

group.title: Pregnant Women Taking Amlodipine
group.description: Women already taking amlodipine besylate 5 mg for treatment of chronic hypertension in pregnancy who plan to breastfeed postpartum will be assigned to the single experimental arm. Amlodipine besylate: Pregnant and postpartum women will continue taking amlodipine besylate 5 mg for treatment of chronic hypertension as prescribed by their clinician.

measurement_list.measurement: This study only included pregnant women.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve for Amlodipine in the Maternal Serum
outcome.description: The time to peak amlodipine concentration in the maternal serum in the peripartum period was be measured.
outcome.time_frame: Maternal blood samples will be obtained at 4, 6, 8, 12, 15 and 24 hours after amlodipine dosing
outcome.population: Although 16 women were enrolled in the study, only 11 of the 16 had blood drawn at the time of delivery. This was due to limitations of study personnel availability to attend the deliveries of all study patients

group.title: Pregnant Women Taking Amlodipine

measure.title: Amlodipine Concentration in Breastmilk
measure.description: The concentration of amlodipine besylate was measured in breastmilk samples.

measurement_list.measurement: Amlodipine concentrations in maternal breast milk were undetectable at the lower limit of assay detection (<0.1 ng/mL).

outcome.title: Drug Level/Concentration in Infant Blood (Amlodipine Level/Concentration)
outcome.description: Infant amlodipine level/concentration will be determined.
outcome.time_frame: Infant blood sample drawn at approximately 36 hours of life
outcome.population: Of the 16 patients enrolled in the study, only 8 continued in the study and allowed their infant's to have study sampling performed.
